### Current Projects

[LXC-Rails](randywallace.github.com/lxc-rails): A Ruby on Rails application devoted to providing an interface for maintaining quasi-virtualized services on a Linux host supporting Application and OS Linux Containers via LXC (Linux Containers)--tightly integrates Linux CGroups for resource management.

[CalMon](randywallace.github.com/CalMon): An application that provides a Server-Client infrastructure for monitoring back-end service startup and shutdown over time via a multi-language client interface, including BASH and NetCat.  Implements the Google Calendar API for creating, modifying, and deleting ‘event’s in real-time.

[Rye with DSL](delano.github.com/rye): The latest version of Rye, a tool for running commands on many servers (like Capistrano), includes a DSL I wrote in the hopes to emulate some of the configuration behaviors of the Python tool Fabric.
